citations.narrative:
The facility’s acquisition and disposition records were incomplete. They did not contain the date of animal intake or
disposition, nor did they contain the name or the address of the employees who adopted the rabbits at the end of the
season. Without records which fully disclose the animal’s acquisition/disposition, legal and medical information traceback
is not possible. Be consistent in maintaining records disclosing the required acquisition/disposition information including
the date, name, address, and USDA number if applicable of the person from whom the animal was acquired from or
transferred to. To be corrected by December 30, 2025.

At the time of inspection, 2 goats were within the same outdoor enclosure as a group of rabbits. Housing rabbits with
other species could lead to injuries, illness, or negatively impact their health and well-being. Rabbits shall not be housed
in the same primary enclosure with any other species of animals unless required for scientific reasons. Correct by October
10, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility’s acquisition and disposition records were incomplete. They did not contain the date of animal intake or 
disposition, nor did they contain the name or the address of the employees who adopted the rabbits at the end of the 
season. Without records which fully disclose the animal’s acquisition/disposition, legal and medical information traceback 
is not possible. Be consistent in maintaining records disclosing the required acquisition/disposition information including 
the date, name, address, and USDA number if applicable of the person from whom the animal was acquired from or 
transferred to. To be corrected by December 30, 2025. 
3.58(a) 
   
Classification and separation. 
At the time of inspection, 2 goats were within the same outdoor enclosure as a group of rabbits. Housing rabbits with 
other species could lead to injuries, illness, or negatively impact their health and well-being. Rabbits shall not be housed 
in the same primary enclosure with any other species of animals unless required for scientific reasons. Correct by October 
10, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
